oai_dc:dc.dc:title: General order No. 43 from the Quartermaster General in Washington concerning horses and mules

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Meigs, Montgomery C. (Montgomery Cunningham), 1816-1892; Cavalry horses; Mules -- War use; Military orders; War use of animals; United States -- Army -- Handbooks, manuals, etc.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Text of general order No. 43 issued by the Quartermaster General's Office in Washington, D. C. ,conveying the rules and regulations with regard to horses and mules. Include blank forms to be used.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- War Dept. -- Adjutant-General's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Record Group 21, Adjutant General's Office Records, 1796-1900
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: General orders are published directives issued by a commander, binding upon all personnel under his command to affect policies or procedures unique to a unit's situation not addressed by service regulations. General orders have the force of law within the unit they are issued.
